entries.name: Age
entries: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 80.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Chaos Dragonborn tend towards chaotic alignments.

entries.name: Size
entries: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

entries.name: Draconic Ancestry
entries: You have draconic ancestry. When you finish a long rest, roll a {@dice d8} and consult the Chaotic Ancestry table. The damage type for your breath weapon and your damage resistance are determined by the number rolled and remain so until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Breath Weapon
entries: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes {@dice 2d6} damage of the type associated with your Chaotic Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level ({@dice 3d6}), 11th level ({@dice 4d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 5d6}).
After you use your breath weapon, you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.

entries.name: Draconic Resistance
entries: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Chaotic Ancestry.

entries.name: Energy Focus
entries: Starting at 5th level, as an action, you can focus your draconic energy to manifest reliably. For 1 minute, the damage type for your breath weapon and damage resistance traits changes from your rolled result to a type of your choice on the Chaotic Ancestry table.
Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic. Draconic is thought to be one of the oldest languages and is often used in the study of magic. The language sounds harsh to most other creatures and includes numerous hard consonants and sibilants.
It's like a Dragonborn for chaotic gamblers.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Chaotic Scales
entries: At the start of each day roll a {@dice d8}. The dragon gains immunity to the rolled damage type, as shown below, until the end of the day.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Energy Focus
entries: The dragon re-rolls the result of its Chaotic Scales trait.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw or take 16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 23} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Chaos Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales lightning in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 24} Dexterity saving throw, taking 75 ({@damage 12d8 + 6d6}) damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Roll a {@dice d8} and consult the Chaotic Scales table, the number rolled determines the breath's damage type.

items.name: Confusing Breath
items.entry: The dragon exhales gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or suffer the effects of the {@spell confusion|PHB} spell for 1 minute.
